prompt:
Nurse: That sounds exciting, Mr. Peck! What play are you planning to see at the theater?

Patient: Samalite.

Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Peck, I didn't quite catch the name of the play. Could you please repeat it for me?

Patient: Camelot.

Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Peck, I didn't quite understand. Are you saying that you're experiencing a change in your speech?

Patient: No. We were talking about what play I was going to see. Never mind. We can move on.

Nurse: Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you. Of course, Mr. Peck. I apologize for any confusion earlier. You were saying you're going to see the play Camelot. That's wonderful! Are you a fan of theater and have you seen this play before?

Patient: I am a fan of the theater, and no I haven't.

responses.gpt4: I'm sure you'll have a great time, theatre is such a wonderful experience. Now, going back to our primary topic, I'd like to double-check: are you experiencing any changes with your speech at the moment?
responses.our_model: That's wonderful, Mr. Peck! It's always exciting to experience a new play. Do you usually go to the theater alone or do you have someone to accompany you?
